Advanced Physical Assessment Across the Lifespan | NYU College of Nursing                                Home   College Directory   Global   News                                           Menu     Search                                                      About   Academics   Admissions   Research   Our Practices   Students   Alumni                                     Sections                                          Undergraduate   Graduate   Clinical Experience   Academic Calendars   Academic Integrity   Academic Affairs   Technical Standards                                     Academics                   Home > Academics                                                                       < Back  Advanced Physical Assessment Across the Lifespan                      NURSE-GN 2012, 3 Credits, (Fall, Spring)  In this course, the advanced practice student develops advanced comprehensive history taking and physical assessment competencies in the context of the nurse-client relationship. The outcomes are achieved via a case-based approach that is hypothesis driven and focuses on clinical decision making using the best available evidence to mutually address client goals using a culturally relevant approach. There is an introduction to laboratory and diagnostic tests and basic electrocardiogram interpretation as part of the decision making process. Health Assessment & Promotion | NYU College of Nursing                                Home   College Directory   Global   News                                           Menu     Search                                                      About   Academics   Admissions   Research   Our Practices   Students   Alumni                                     Sections                                          Undergraduate   Graduate   Clinical Experience   Academic Calendars   Academic Integrity   Academic Affairs   Technical Standards                                     Academics                   Home > Academics                                                                       < Back  Health Assessment & Promotion                      NURSE-UN 239, 4 Credits, (Fall, Spring)  This course provides the knowledge, skills, and attitudes to perform culturally competent and comprehensive health history and physical assessment of adult and older adult patients of diverse backgrounds and orientation and across diverse settings. The focus is on developing nursing process competencies, nursing process assessment competency for differentiating between normal and abnormal findings, clustering data, formulating relevant nursing diagnoses, accurately documenting findings, and initiating strategies for health promotion and disease prevention.
